page.title: 09Solid Fuel In Bishop Monkton
page.content: { {Mining. } There are no coal measures beneath the area, and coal is obtained by retailers from the more Southerly parts of Yorkshire, from Lancashire and from the Durham coalfield. { { {Coal. }This is used for domestic heating in many houses,both new and old,and for cooking in a few.The coal is burnt in open grates in some cases in others there are back boilers for heating radiators. Various types of{smokeless fuel}are also used.The fuel is mainly supplied by a retailer resident in the village. The fuel is supplied by lorry in weighed sacks,carried to the dwelling by hand,and stored at the dwellings.
